revised_title: Vapour Pressure and Apparent Superheating of Solid Bromine: An Optical Method of Measurement
tldr: The authors develop an optical method to measure vapour pressures and discover the phenomenon of apparent superheating in solid bromine. They find that the vapour pressure increases above the expected value at the melting point before eventually decreasing, suggesting that this method could be useful in studying rapid and delicate changes in vapour pressure at freezing points.
